title: On your bike
des: Sophie and Neil discuss the bike's mass appeal, from helping to widen the gene pool to blazing a trail for the women’s movement

title: Hi, meet my online persona!
des: Sophie and Neil discuss social networks and why we often use different identities for different social media

title: How do you read your news?
des: Free, digital news is threatening traditional newspapers. Sophie and Neil discuss the pros and cons of news in print

title: Do opposites attract?
des: Why are we attracted to some people and not to others? Sophie and Neil discuss love at first sight

title: Is loneliness in our genes?
des: What is loneliness and why do we feel it? Sophie and Neil discuss how feeling lonely can help us to survive

title: Who do you think you are?
des: How do you see yourself and how do others see you? Alice and Neil discuss identity and how appearances can be deceptive

title: Does punctuation matter?
des: Why is punctuation important? Neil and Alice discuss rhetoric, commas and full stops.

title: Penicillin: breaking the mould
des: Alice and Neil discuss penicillin, the so-called wonder drug discovered in 1928 by Alexander Fleming

title: Global warming
des: What might the world look like if temperatures keep rising? Neil and Alice discuss the need to adapt to the changes ahead

title: Old tech
des: Did you ever own a Walkman or a record player? Alice and Neil discuss old tech and why the US Pentagon still uses floppy disks

title: Slang
des: Neil and Alice discuss the differences between slang, jargon, and swearing, while teaching you some Cockney Rhyming Slang

title: Domestic chores
des: Do women clean the house more often than men? Alice and Neil discuss the topic and teach you a tidy amount of vocabulary

title: Have you walked off your pizza?
des: Is food labelling clear enough to help us make healthy choices? Alice and Neil discuss chocolate chip muffins along with some other tasty vocabulary

title: How to cure writer's block
des: Who were the Muses and how did they help the creative process? Neil and Alice discuss how to be more creative

title: Is English changing?
des: Will we still be speaking in an English we recognise in a thousand years' time? Alice and Neil make some educated guesses!

title: Heritage sites
des: Neil and Alice discuss the threat to The Great Barrier Reef, the Grand Canyon, and the Inca city of Machu Picchu in Peru

title: Are we there yet?
des: Why do some weeks just fly by but sometimes minutes can seem like hours? Neil and Alice discuss our perception of time

title: Cities of the future
des: What will the cities of the future look like, and will we enjoy living in them? Alice and Neil discuss Neil's attempt at town planning

title: Diabetes
des: Why is the disease diabetes on the rise? Alice and Neil talk about the role that diet has to play in this global health problem

title: Get on with it!
des: Why do we procrastinate? Rob and Alice discuss why it can be difficult to get on with tasks

title: Who would you imitate?
des: Why do we like to impersonate people? Neil tries out his best impression of Elvis while teaching you some related vocabulary.

title: How to prepare for an exam
des: Alice and Rob consider which study techniques are good and which aren't. Does sleeping with a book under your pillow help?

title: Young and in business
des: New young entrepreneurs are appearing everywhere. Alice and Rob discuss whether grey hair is best

title: Do as I say, not as I do
des: Why do people often say one thing and do another? Alice and Rob ask how far hypocrisy is actually part of who we are

title: Could you be an astronaut?
des: Do you have what it takes to go to space? Alice and Rob discuss the challenges of a job thousands of people are keen on

title: Conspiracy theories
des: Do you believe men walked on the Moon? Alice and Rob discuss why some people are suspicious about everything

title: Have you got too much stuff?
des: You've de-cluttered and tidied but could you live life free of stuff? Alice and Rob discuss why we give objects emotional value

title: How bad is booze?
des: Are you a teetotaler or a drinker? Rob and Alice discuss what risk to your health regular drinking may have

title: Is chivalry dead?
des: What does it take to impress the ladies in the 21st century? Neil and Alice discuss knights in shining armour

title: Never too old
des: Is retirement the end of everything or just a door for new opportunities? Alice and Rob talk about aging

title: Do you think for yourself?
des: Do you always agree with what most people in your group say? Neil and Sophie discuss staff meetings.

title: Brain training
des: Neil and Sophie discuss the health benefits of being able to speak two languages fluently. And Neil... speaks Japanese!

title: Is social media a distraction?
des: How often do you check your phone? Neil and Sophie discuss how social media is changing the way we interact.

title: Gardening
des: Sophie and Neil discover that soil has some surprising qualities and discuss how growing food can be therapeutic too

title: What's in a fairy tale?
des: Sophie and Neil talk about traditional fairy tales for the adult market and teach you some magical vocabulary

title: Corporate team building
des: Neil and Sophie discuss the growing industry of team building – from zombie bootcamps to horse training for executives.

title: Life on Mars
des: Neil and Sophie discuss Mars, the fourth rock from the Sun

title: It's all in the genes
des: Neil and Sophie talk about gene editing, designer babies and how many errors Neil might have in his genetic code.

title: Giving away your fortune
des: How generous are you? Neil and Sophie discuss Mark Zuckerberg and what it takes to be a modern-day philanthropist.

title: How would you like to pay?
des: Are the days of paying by cash for a latte or a newspaper nearly gone? Alice and Neil discuss Neil's fondness for loose change...

title: How do you like your tea?
des: Tea comes in different forms – milky, sweet or spicy. Alice and Neil discuss how this Asian leaf conquered the world.

title: The commute
des: Train, car, bicycle ... Hundreds of millions of us make the same journey day in day out. Take a hike with Alice and Neil and learn new vocabulary.

title: Are we afraid of food?
des: Are food allergies on the increase and if so, why? Neil and Alice talk about the growing fear of food and teach new words.

title: Is modern life making us tired?
des: Are artificial lights and late night TV ruining our sleep? Neil and Alice discuss the issue and teach you related vocabulary.

title: Asking the right questions
des: What does it take to be a good interviewer? Neil and Alice discuss TV chat show hosts and teach you some related vocabulary.

title: The way we look
des: How much does appearance really matter? Neil and Alice discuss fitness and New Year's resolutions

title: Christmas kindness
des: Some families struggle to buy even food and can’t afford presents. Neil and Alice discuss how some charities are helping those in need.

title: Why do we take risks?
des: Alice and Finn talk about the passion some people have for danger and the unseen threats we face every day

title: Is student life all good?
des: Alice and Neil discuss the psychological pressures of going to university. They also teach some related vocabulary.

title: Robin Hood
des: Neil and Alice discuss the long-lasting appeal of this man with a bow and how he has changed over the centuries

title: How much is your spouse worth?
des: Do you know how much your partner earns? Is he or she in debt? Would this make you love them less?

title: 100 Women
des: The BBC broadcasts a season of programmes discussing women's issues around the world

title: What makes us laugh?
des: Are you good at telling jokes? What makes a good comedian?

title: The impact of plastic
des: Should we all pay for supermarket plastic bags? Neil and Alice take a look at the environmental impact of plastic and teach you some related words.

title: Shakespeare in plain English
des: Should the difficult language of Shakespeare be 'translated' into plain English?

title: New transport on two wheels
des: The bicycle is the most popular form of two-wheeled transport in the world, but could we all soon be using hoverboards? Listen to Neil and Finn's conversation and learn some new words.

title: Will robots take our jobs?
des: If you are sitting at a desk or answering the phone, stop for a moment and ask: could a robot or machine do this job better? Neil and Finn discuss the future of our jobs.

title: Do we read to show off?
des: Neil and Alice discuss what kind of book people like to be seen reading. Do you like to impress people with a classic book in your hands?

title: Summer-born kids
des: Does being born in the summer reduce your chance of going to university?

title: The Earth's core
des: Take a trip with Rob and Alice to find out about the Earth’s core. They’ll discuss how hot it is – and whether there are any dinosaurs living there!

title: The meaning of clothes
des: Do you dress formally or casually? Do you choose trendy items or old comfortable ones? Rob and Will talk about the meaning of clothes.

title: The Proms
des: It's been described as the world's largest and most democratic classical music festival. Neil and Finn guide you through the BBC Proms

title: Is knuckle cracking good for you?
des: What an awful sound - cracking your knuckles! Listen in to Rob and Neil to find out if it's a useful skill or just an annoying habit

title: Evolution before Darwin
des: Was Charles Darwin the only man with ideas about evolution? Rob and Neil talk about someone else who discovered it first.

title: Lifts
des: What are the modern day dilemmas in using a lift? Rob and Neil discuss the awkwardness and irritation of being in one

title: Compulsory voting
des: Should young people be made to vote in elections or should we choose? We discuss the ideas behind compulsory voting

title: Chins
des: What do we need our chins for? Rob and Neil discuss how we got them and what our chins say about us

title: Why do gibbons sing duets?
des: Why do gibbons sing duets and what has this got to do with the evolution of the human language?

title: Are models too skinny?
des: Skinny models: What does the law say about walking the catwalk?

title: Is a game just a game?
des: The dangers of computer games. How good are they for our health?

title: The wonder of blood
des: It's amazing! What part of our body have scientists discovered can heal and help us?

title: Why did Singapore ban gum?
des: Do you chew gum and what do you do with it when you've finished? Listen to Rob and Finn discussing the history and chemical properties of gum and why it's messing up our streets whilst explaining some related vocabulary

title: Food banks
des: Food banks provide food to people in the UK who can't afford to buy their own. Rob and Finn discuss this how they work and how they help many of the country's poorest

title: The teenage brain
des: Listen to Neil and Rob discussing mood swings, risk taking, and why people make fun of teenagers, while they also explore some related vocabulary.

title: The Outernet
des: How can remote parts of the world get access to the internet? Neil and Catherine discuss a new idea for spreading knowledge

title: Is aggression useful?
des: What makes us angry and why is aggression useful? Neil and Catherine discuss human behaviour.

title: Are beards back to stay?
des: Big bushy beards have become so fashionable that there's now an art exhibition dedicated to them

title: Is a door just a door?
des: A London apartment block has front and back entrances for private and social housing - or so-called rich and poor doors. Does it make sense to you? Listen to a discussion whilst learning some housing-related vocabulary

title: The first space walk
des: Fifty years ago, on 18 March 1965, Soviet astronaut Alexei Leonov took the first space walk. Listen to Rob and Neil describing the struggles of that ground-breaking space mission whilst explaining some related vocabulary.

title: Wireless furniture for phones
des: Furniture with built-in wireless charging technology - like a coffee table is now being sold. 'Built-in' means the technology is included as part of the table. So you just pop your phone on the table, and technology does the rest!

title: Saving China's elephants
des: Many animals face extinction. But people are realising that they must act now to stop further losses. A scheme to save the Asian elephant in China could provide an answer.

title: Life without music
des: How does music make you feel? Research shows that it actually influences us more than we realise - whether we're at the movies, the supermarket, or down the pub

title: The story behind coffee
des: Coffee is now the most popular drink in the world. But what about the economics and politics of coffee production? It's as complicated as getting the right flavour in your cup

title: The sun
des: Rob and Neil put on their sunglasses to find out more about this special star and teach some related vocabulary. We promise you won’t be blinded with science!

title: The three-parent baby
des: The UK has become the first country to approve legislation allowing the creation of babies with genetic material from three people. Listen to Neil and Harry’s conversation and learn some related vocabulary.

title: A threat to London's artwork?
des: What are some art galleries banning to protect their paintings? Neil and Harry discuss

title: Human microchips
des: An electronic device under your skin?! Workers in Sweden take part in experiment which allows them to get in and out of their office without a key, ID or password. Listen to Neil and Harry’s chat and learn some related vocabulary.

title: The two sides of Churchill
des: This year marks the 50th anniversary of Winston Churchill’s death. He is known throughout the world for his role in defeating Nazi Germany but he also made mistakes. Listen to Neil and Mike’s discussion, and learn new vocabulary.

title: Poverty in a rich world
des: We live in a richer world. But the gap between rich and poor is still very wide in individual countries. How to change this? Listen to Rob and Harry’s discussion, and learn some related vocabulary.

title: The cost of life-saving vaccines
des: The price of vaccines has escalated and some poor countries are struggling to prevent children from catching certain life-threatening diseases, says Medecins Sans Frontieres. Listen to Rob and Neil’s discussion, and learn some related vocabulary.

title: Do you fear Artificial Intelligence?
des: Will thinking computers be the end of humans? Listen to Rob and Neil’s chat and learn some related vocabulary.

title: Should tourists go to Antarctica?
des: About 37,000 tourists are expected to visit Antarctica this season. But should they be going to a region with such a sensitive environment? Listen to Rob and Neil’s conversation and learn some new vocabulary.

title: Does your CV shine?
des: At a time when more people compete for fewer jobs, are you sure you present your skills and abilities well to a potential employer? Listen to Rob and Neil's conversation and learn some related vocabulary.

title: Are you big on small talk?
des: Going to a party where you don't know anyone? Listen to Rob and Neil's advice and learn some related vocabulary

title: Are computers making us dumb?
des: We use computers for everything nowadays. Are we forgetting our own abilities - and losing our talent? Listen to Rob and Neil's discussion, and learn some related vocabulary

title: Smokers to face one more ban
des: Smoking in cars with children might be banned in England. Listen to Neil and Rob's chat and learn some related vocabulary

title: Bullying or normal competition?
des: Is bullying just an attempt to give a bad name to what is part of human nature? Listen to Rob and Neil’s chat and learn some related vocabulary.

title: Time capsules
des: What would you put in your time capsule? Listen to Rob and Neil’s chat and learn new vocabulary

title: The Christmas Truce
des: When enemy soldiers sang together in WW1. Listen to Rob and Finn’s chat and learn some related vocabulary.

title: 42 languages
des: The London school where students speak 42 different languages

title: Laughter is bad for you
des: Laughter isn't always the best medicine, says research

title: Cloud of suspicion
des: Are your pictures, documents and videos safe online? Listen to Rob and Finn's chat and learn new vocabulary

title: Sharing economy
des: Nowhere to park? How the sharing economy is changing the way we use our space

title: Can science fiction save the world?
des: How can science fiction help the world? Rob and Finn discuss a project which aims to inspire through stories of a bright future

title: Is eating meat killing our planet?
des: Why is eating meat bad news?

title: What makes a superhero?
des: Do real-life superheroes exist or are they just cartoon characters?

title: Cigarettes v e-cigarettes
des: Rob and Finn discuss the World Health Organisation's recommendations on e-cigarettes

title: The bitter taste of sugar
des: Should we eat less sugar?  Listen to Rob and Neil and learn new vocabulary

title: How quickly can you learn English?
des: Is learning English getting easier? Find out what's new

title: Food waste
des: Why do we buy so much food and not eat it all? Learn more about food waste

title: Sleeping on the job
des: Is it right to sleep at work? Rob and Finn discuss the benefits of sleeping on the job.

title: The fame game
des: Is the way we see famous people a new thing? Learn about the first 'modern celebrity'.

title: Dealing with boredom
des: Bored? You're not alone. Rob and Finn discuss how to deal with boredom and teach some related vocabulary. We promise you won't be bored!
